coverageText:
(Verse 1)
In shadows cast by time's relentless hand,  
Doth memory weave its subtle, soft embrace.  
O fleeting hours, dost thou not understand,  
How sweet remembrance masks thy fleeting pace?  
Within the heart, past echoes softly sing,  
Of days once bright, now dimmed by evening's wing.  

(Chorus)  
O time, thou tyrant, with thy ceaseless flow,  
Dost thou not see the tears thou causeth here?  
Yet in thy course, doth sacred moments glow,  
In memory's keep, where all is held most dear.  

(Verse 2)  
Thou art a river, wild and free to roam,  
With naught to bind thee, nor thy rollicking waves.  
Thy current sweeps the footfalls far from home,  
Yet in thy depth, bright memory bravely braves.  
Returns the light of ages long since passed,  
In shimmers bright where shadows erst were cast.  

(Bridge)  
If time be foe, then memory the knight,  
Oft wielding joy against the creeping night.  
And though the sands hast ever slipped away,  
In memory's gentle clutch must moments stay.  

(Chorus)  
O time, thou tyrant, with thy ceaseless flow,  
Dost thou not see the tears thou causeth here?  
Yet in thy course, doth sacred moments glow,  
In memory's keep, where all is held most dear.  

(Outro)  
So sing we of the love forgotten not,  
In memory's tender realm, ne'er to rot.  
Though time may claim the present from our hand,  
In echoes sweet, our past shall ever stand.
